alert.note: Alert for Lenawee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 7:13PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lenawee County through 815 PM EDT... At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Adrian, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Adrian around 725 PM EDT. Tecumseh around 745 PM EDT. Blissfield around 800 PM EDT. Britton around 805 PM EDT. Deerfield around 815 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Rome Center, Ridgeway, Palmyra, Tipton, Holloway, Sand Creek, Cadmus and Manitou Beach-Devils Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
